thread.title: There is someone already camping out at Apple store
thread.title_full: There is someone already camping out at Apple store

title: There is someone already camping out at Apple store
text:
The Apple logo is displayed on an iPhone 6 on July 21, 2015 in San Francisco, California. (Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images)
4 CONNECT 27 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Apple has yet to even say a word about what to expect in its next iPhone, or whether the revamped Apple TV is real, but there's already one person apparently camping outside one of the tech giant's stores ahead of their big fall event on Wednesday.
A tweet from an editor of Cnet in Australia shows a tent propped up outside an Apple store in Sydney.
Oh my. Peak Apple. Someone is queuing in Sydney before THEY HAVE EVEN ANNOUNCED ANYTHING!!! pic.twitter.com/G16X0ze8eN
â€” Seamus Byrne (@seamus) September 8, 2015 Whether the person (or people) in that tent are there for an iPhone or a revamped Apple TV is unclear, keep in mind this happened last year, too . As some may recall, several people were in lines at Apple's flagship store in Fifth Avenue in New York days before an event would reveal the first official details of the iPhone 6 and 6 Plus.
The tent in that tweet features a logo, and as our story from last year notes , some people waiting in line in New York were paid to pitch products while camping out. It's possible we have a similar scenario here.
Also, Apple usually waits roughly two weeks between the event and the launch date of the device. So it looks like that tent will be there a while.
Apple is expected to reveal the next iPhone on Wednesday.
Follow Brett Molina on Twitter: @brettmolina23 .
4 CONNECT 27 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 //usat.ly/1UECLoO TOP VIDEOS
